meanings.sent1: The two batteries were equipotential in their power output.
meanings.sent2: The equipotential wires ensured a balanced flow of electricity.
meanings.sent3: The race was so close, it felt like the equipotential finish line was teasing the runners.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor created an equipotential atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The symmetrical design of the room gave it an equipotential look.

meanings.definition: A surface on which the potential is the same at every point
meanings.sent1: The equipotential of the field made it safe for the players to practice.
meanings.sent2: The equipotential of the lake's surface allowed for smooth sailing.
meanings.sent3: The equipotential of the cake's frosting made it perfect for sharing.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them was like an equipotential, always at the same level.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully created an equipotential canvas for their masterpiece.
